mdRecord.dcterms:title: Mineral territory tributary to Norfolk and Western Railroad
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Relief shown by spot heights, hachures and shading. [original]
Before 1896 when the Norfolk and Western Railroad Company became the Norfolk and Western Railway Company. [original]
"Explanations" color coded for types of mineral deposits. Also coded for state, county and railroad lines. [original]
Geographical area extends from Floyd County, W.Va. to Madison, Va. in the northeast corner and south to central North Carolina and Tennessee [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: From the Anderson Papers, MSS 39-96-i; gift of Mrs. John R. Weske. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: From the Anderson Papers, MSS 39-96-i; gift of Mrs. John R. Weske. [original]
